subject: Travel
title: Earthquakes That Toppled Giants
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Earthquakes That Toppled Giants.

hook.text: The Colossus of Rhodes stood for only 56 years before an earthquake snapped it at the knees.

buildup.text: The Lighthouse of Alexandria survived many quakes but finally collapsed after a series in 1303.

discovery.text: The eastern Mediterranean sits on active fault lines. Earthquakes were the top killer of wonders.

twist.text: The Pharos Lighthouse had survived 1,500 years of storms before the ground betrayed it.

climax.text: Rhodes refused to rebuild the Colossus. An oracle warned that they had offended Helios.

punchline.text: Nature brought down what armies could not.

quiz.question: What natural force destroyed the most ancient wonders?
